intro: Mentzelia tiehmii, commonly known as Tiehm's bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
